comments:
I had a perfectly fine working version of 3.1.1 (JBoss IDE actually) with several other features installed, subclipse, etc. Everything worked fine. 

I installed 3.1.2. I then used our LAN based local update sites to try to reinstall the various features I had. No luck. Any site I use, including remote sites which work perfectly from an identical machine simply come back with a 'No features to install' message. 

I try to examine my log file, there is none. Eclipse itself SEEMS to work normally, but all feature management is futile. Rolling back to my previous version now produces the same results. Blowing away my entire workspace AND eclipse and reinstalling EVERYTHING, no dice. No version of eclipse I put on the machine will produce a log file and none of them will install anything.

Created an attachment (id=36482)
eclipse log file

Dunno why I now HAVE a log file, this is something like the 5th reinstall of eclipse, finally today it deigns to actually bother to WRITE one...

From your stack trace it is obvious that the problem was on your update site:

Character conversion error: "Malformed UTF-8 char -- is an XML encoding declaration missing?" (line number may be too low).]
!STACK 0
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Character conversion error: "Malformed UTF-8 char -- is an XML encoding declaration missing?" (line number may be too low).
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.InputEntity.fatal(InputEntity.java:1100)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.InputEntity.fillbuf(InputEntity.java:1072)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.InputEntity.isXmlDeclOrTextDeclPrefix(InputEntity.java:914)
	at org.apache.crimson.parser.Parser2.maybeXmlDecl(Parser2.java:1183)

traces.message: Character conversion error: "Malformed UTF-8 char -- is an XML encoding declaration missing?" (line number may be too low).
